com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter
Class AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter.FilterBase
      com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter.AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Filter, Writable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ColumnVersionTimerangeFilter, FamilyOnlyColumnVersionTimerangeFilter
public abstract class AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter
extends FilterBase

Abstract base class for filtering a column based on a timerange and number of versions, specifically meant to implement the column selection functionality of the Query Planner.

Author:
jeff@opower.com

AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter

protected AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter(int maxVersions,
                                               long start,
                                               long stop)
Create a filter based on the maximum number of versions and a timerange to check. The timerange is inclusive at the beginning and exclusive on the end: [start, stop).

Parameters:
maxVersions -
start -
stop -

resetCurrentVersionCount

protected final void resetCurrentVersionCount()

includeFamilyAndQualifier

protected abstract boolean includeFamilyAndQualifier(KeyValue keyValue)
Determine if the KeyValue should be included based on its family and qualifier. Further checks for maximum number of versions and the timerange will be done after this method is called, assuming it returns true. If this method returns false, then the KeyValue will be skipped.

Parameters:
keyValue - the KeyValue to check if it should be included in the results
Returns:
true if it should be included, false otherwise

resetVersionCount

protected abstract boolean resetVersionCount(KeyValue keyValue)
Determine if the count of the current number of versions for the current KeyValue should be reset.

Parameters:
keyValue - the KeyValue under inspection
Returns:
true if the version count should be reset, false otherwise
